images.copyright: Sunlit ridges against volcanic scree on Eyjafjallajökull, a volcano in Iceland (© Erlend Haarberg/Minden Pictures)
images.title: Sunlight sets Iceland's Eyjafjallajökull aglow
images.caption: Sunlight sets Iceland's Eyjafjallajökull aglow
images.desc: This is the sun-soaked ice cap of Iceland's Eyjafjallajökull. Remember the name? It's that unpronounceable volcano that caused the biggest disruption to air traffic since World War II. And this relatively small, but volatile island in the North Atlantic may yet waylay the world again: Eyjafjallajökull is a lightweight among the 32 active volcanic systems dotting the Land of Fire and Ice—its much larger neighbor Katla has been closely monitored since the 2010 incident.

tooltips.walls: இந்த படத்தை பதிவிறக்கவும். வால்பேப்பருக்கு மட்டுமே பயன்படுத்த இந்தப் படம் கட்டுப்படுத்தப்பட்டுள்ளது.
